location.name: Zadarska Županija
location.activity-description: farmer activity data collection, edu/info workshops, public media capaigns, preparation for brending of agriculture products of ZD County

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: - increased No of development projects ready for implementation and applying for EU and other development funds - increased No of LAGs and capacities within

baseline.comment: - low absorption capacity of EU funds in rural areas, no project ideas elaborated - no Local Action Groups (LAG) established with capacities to use EU funds

target.comment: - catalogue of 30 rural development projects developed with 15 project ideas elaborated for EU funding - database of 100 rural stakeholders in Zadar county developed, as a basis for furhter programming and projects preprarion to be funded from rural development funds - Sign of quality and visual identity of agricultural and other rural products of Zadar County prepared

iati-activity.title: Strengthening National Protected Area System_PARCS
iati-activity.description: PIMS 4731: Strengthening the Institutional and Financial Sustainability of the National Protected Area System (Croatia)_PARCS project

iati-activity.title: National Protected Area System
iati-activity.description: Improving current institutional framework for national protected areas; improving financial sustainability of national protected areas to ensure they have adequate financial resources.

location.name: Croatia
location.activity-description: The project focuses on "national protected areas" (NPA) that include 8 National Parks and 11 Nature Parks located throughout Croatia. First project component is focused on overall improvement of protected area system in Croatia. Second project component is focused on implementation of specific proje

result.title: Objective
result.description: Enhancing the management effectiveness and sustainability of national protected areas to safeguard terrestrial and marine biodiversity

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Increase of financial sustainability scorecard for national system of protected areas

actual.comment: It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period (indicator will be updated at the mid-term of the project in 2016).

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Capacity development indicator score for protected area system

actual.comment: It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period (indicator will be updated at the mid-term of the project in 2016).

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Annual financing gap of the ‘optimal management scenario’ for national protected areas (US$)

actual.comment: It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period (indicator will be updated at the mid-term of the project in 2016).

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description:
Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool scorecard (average):
All national PAs
National Parks
Nature Parks

baseline.comment:
All national PAs: 63%
National Parks: 62%
Nature Parks: 64%

target.comment:
All national PAs: 67%
National Parks: 67%
Nature Parks: 67%

actual.comment: It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period (indicator will be updated at the mid-term of the project in 2016).

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Income/annum (US$), by source, from national protected areas

baseline.comment:
Government budget allocation: US$6,67m
Other government allocation: US$1m
Property income: US$1.4m
Own income: US$58.29m
Donor revenue and other income: US$0,94m

target.comment:
Government budget allocation: US$5m
Other government allocation: US$3.5m
Property income: US$2m
Own income: US$65m
Donor revenue and other income: US$1.5m
(target year = 2017)

actual.comment:
Government budget allocations: US$ 5,661,945
Other government income: US$ 2,084,037
Property Income: US$ 599,501
Own Income: US$ 58,046,247
Donor Revenue: US$ 203,156
TOTAL USD 66,594,886
(Data available for December 31, 2014
Source: Annual financial reports)

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description:
Degree of conservation for the Natura 2000 target species and habitats in national protected areas[1]
[1] Where:
A = excellent level of conservation;
B = good level of conservation; and
C = average or less than average level of conservation)

baseline.comment:
Species:
A – 184
B – 214
C – 14
Habitats:
A – 94
B – 91
C – 8

target.comment: Degree of conservation for the NATURA 2000 target species and habitats stays the same or improves

actual.comment: It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period (indicator will be updated at the mid-term of the project in 2016).

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Reforming the institutional framework to strengthen the management effectiveness of national protected areas

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Strategic plan and management guidelines for national protected areas approved.

baseline.comment:
Strategic plan: None
Management guidelines: Partial, but incomplete

target.comment:
Strategic plan: Yes
Management guidelines: Complete

actual.comment:
It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period.
It is expected that Nature protection law and NBSAP will be adopted by the Government in September 2015. Having strategic guidance in the two most important documents will provide guidance for development of a national planning framework for the protected area system. Upon this, strategic plan and management guidelines for national protected areas will be developed and adopted.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number of park management plans conforming with the policies and guidelines for national protected areas

actual.comment:
It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period.
The activities for this Output have been started. Meeting of Technical Work Group was organized and it was concluded that several important guidelineses need to be prepared by the Ministry as precondition for revision of park management plans.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Number of financial/business plans adopted and operational

baseline.comment:
National protected area network: 0
Individual national protected areas: 0

target.comment:
National protected area network: 1
Individual national protected areas: 3

actual.comment:
It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period.
Financial plans will be developed upon adoption of Strategic plan and management guidelines for national protected (described above).

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Number of PI and MENP staff completing specialised, targeted short-course financial training and financial skills development programmes

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Percentage of overall national protected areas bookings/month being administered through the centralised SSC:

actual.comment:
It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period.
Shared Service Centre hasn't been established. Upon establishment of the agency, web based booking will be organized as their service. First results are expacted at the end of 2016.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Improving the financial sustainability of the network of national protected areas

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Net income (US$/annum) from sales of smart cards

actual.comment:
It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period.
The process of introduction of advanced ticketing systems in several parks is started and systems will be operational in first half of 2016. The calculation of achieved income from sales will be possible in 2017.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Increase in self-generated income (US$/annum) in target national parks and nature parks

baseline.comment:
Ucka: US$49k
Risnjak: US$279k
Papuk: US$32k
Telascica: US$614k
Vransko jezero: US$56k

target.comment:
Ucka: US$100k
Risnjak: US$450k
Papuk: US$50k
Telascica: US$1m
Vransko jezero: US$100k

actual.comment:
It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period.
Implementation of all of the planned activities is started. During 2015 and 2016 the majority of planned activities will be implemented and the calculation of achieved results will be possible in 2017.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Decrease in costs (US$/month) of power supply to targeted nature parks

baseline.comment:
Risnjak Nature Park: US$1,455
Papuk Nature Park: US$745

target.comment:
Risnjak Nature Park: <us$1,000
Papuk Nature Park: <us$500< p=""> </us$500<> </us$1,000

actual.comment:
It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period.
The activities of deep renovation of buildings in Nature park Papuk and National park Risnjak are ongoing. Finalization of reconstruction of building in Papuk is expected in first quarter of 2016, and of building on Risnjak third quarter of 2016. The calculation of achieved savings will be possible in 2017.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Surplus/(deficit) per annum (US$) for high-income national protected areas

baseline.comment:
Plitvicka jezera National Park: US$4.7m
Krka National Park: US$0.9m
Brijuni National Park: US$(-0.5m)

target.comment:
Plitvicka jezera National Park: US$5.7m
Krka National Park: US$1.1m
Brijuni National Park: US$0.5m

actual.comment:
It is not possible to calculate target level at this reporting period.
The preparatory works under these activities have been started. Implementation of activities is planned in 2016, and the calculation of achieved results will be done in 2017.
